abstract.para: The selfcal Blackboard for the LOFAR project will have a hierarchical organisation. The structure thereof is described in this document.

section.title: Workload distribution
section.para:
The workload for a self-calibration process, might be distributed in several ways. It is a design choice to decide that only partitioning to data, as opposed to partitioning to parameters, is opportune. This is based on the order of magnitude that the volume of data is bigger then the amount of parameters. The data has a limited number of dimensions. The number of dimensions is four as far as we can tell right now These are.
time
frequency
baseline
observatory-direction
The Blackboard will be configured to delegate tasks to children, divided along one of these dimensions.It doesn't seem necessary to divide along a dimension more then once.

section.title: controllers
section.para: A Blackboard has a controller that can be asked to start a process for a blackboard. Such a process can be a child-blackboard including its controller, or one of the knowledge sources associated with the blackboard.
